Android Phones that work with MMR?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: My Monster Rancher Archive (Andriod): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Android Phones that work with MMR?
By Lisa Shock on Sunday, January 1, 2012 - 12:56 pm:

I am going to post a list of phones that work with My Monster Rancher. There's a list at the developer website, but, if people could post their phone types it would be useful for others to know.

One way to play this game is to get a phone and not activate it, just use the wifi.

By Penguin God on Monday, January 2, 2012 - 11:30 am:

A slight update to all the ones you have. It also works with the newer Mytouch 4G Slide. Not a big difference, but thought I'd mention it.

By mongooseroar on Monday, January 2, 2012 - 11:53 am:

I use a Samsung Exhibit II 4G

By Anzer D. Fone on Tuesday, January 3, 2012 - 01:32 am:

It took a while to actually load up, but my Sony
Ericsson Xperia (not the Play, and I'll edit in the
exact model later because I'm not sure what it is)
got it working.

By Anzer D. Fone on Thursday, January 5, 2012 - 04:43 am:

Update: It's a Sony Ericsson Xperia, Model Number U20i,
Firmware version 2.1-update1 (that last part may or may not
matter)

By Greek Snake on Tuesday, January 10, 2012 - 04:30 pm:

Can confirm this works on a Sony Ericsson Xperia Arc. Not the S just the regular one.

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, January 11, 2012 - 10:10 am:

Thanks! List updated, keep 'em coming!

By tiakall on Sunday, April 8, 2012 - 09:48 am:

Mine's an HTC Evo Design, though that's practically the same as a 4G.

By Rahu on Tuesday, January 1, 2013 - 02:12 pm:

Anybody know if you can get this on a Kindle Fire?

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, January 1, 2013 - 02:27 pm:

It's thought that won't work -limited access to a bunch of Google apps, including no Play store. There's a big maybe, if you're willing to root it -but, you could wind up with an expensive brick that way.

I'd really like to find an inexpensive tablet to play MMR on (wi-fi, no cell phone contract), but, no one has confirmed any possibilities.

By Rahu on Tuesday, January 1, 2013 - 03:04 pm:

Oh well. Thanks for the info.

By Seija on Sunday, October 6, 2013 - 04:15 pm:

It's not really an Android phone, but the LG Intuition has been
running the app beautifuly so far.

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, October 6, 2013 - 06:25 pm:

Thanks!
